panels.content:
![logo image](http://imars-webserver-01.marine.usf.edu/fk/FWC_DB_imagepanel_sized.png)



Select a specific location using the "Locations" dropdown menu at left.

The range of the displayed time period can be adjusted at top right.

Locations of extracted data:
* SLI: St. Lucie River Inlet
* PBI: Palm Beach Inlet
* PEV: Port Everglades
* MIA: Miami
* MOL: Molasses Reef
* SOM: Sombrero Key
* KW: Key West
panels.title: General information
Cumulative percent of sampling sites infected
Gage height from rivers on Florida's east coast (sum of gage height from rivers shown by red circles on map)
River discharge into Florida Bay (combined discharge from gages shown as green circles on map)
In-situ salinity (psu) from Peterson Key buoy (yellow circle on map)
In-situ temperature (DegC) at 0.5m from Peterson Key buoy

panels.content:
* Satellite data is from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS-Aqua) sensor and the Visible Infrared Imaging Spectrometer Suite (VIIRS). All satellite products are obtained from the [Ocean Biology Processing Group](https://oceancolor.gsfc.nasa.gov/) at NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center.

* Algal Bloom Index (ABI) is calculated using the method of Hu and Feng (2016; doi: 10.1117/1.JRS.11.012003) 

* River discharge and gage height data are obtained from the [USGS National Water Information System](https://waterdata.usgs.gov/nwis). Gage height values for the 135th Street Canal, Loxahatchee and St. Lucie Rivers (red circles on map above) are summed for the eastern Florida rivers. Discharge values from the Shark, Harney, Broad, Lostman's and Chatham Rivers (green circles on map) are summed for discharge into Florida Bay shown on plot above.

* Buoy at Peterson Key is operated by the National Park Service and data are obtained from the [National Data Buoy Center.](https://www.ndbc.noaa.gov/) 

Please feel free to contact us with questions or to sign up for email alerts:

Dr. Dan Otis - [dotis@usf.edu](mailto:dotis@mail.usf.edu)
